intro: Trisyngyne codonandra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed codonandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Trisyngyne codonandra is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its arid and coastal habitats.
